content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace (position: 0.0, 0.0) – Smelts iron ore into iron plates to support crafting operations.
• Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5) – Stores produced iron plates.

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (-16.0, -51.0)
Consists of:
• Burner Mining Drill (position: -16.0, -51.0) – Extracts iron ore.
• Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -49.5) – Transfers ore from the extraction point.
• Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -49.5) – Delivers extracted ore.
• Iron Chest (position: -13.5, -49.5) – Stores delivered ore.
• Intermediate Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -47.5) – Feeds ore to a remote branch.
• Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -47.5) – Moves ore along the intermediate belt.
• Remote Output Chest (position: -13.5, -47.5) – Receives ore from the remote inserter.

### Copper Furnace at position (-27.0, -60.0)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace (position: -27.0, -60.0) – Smelts copper ore into copper plates.

### Lab Power Integration System at position (0.5, 2.5)
Consists of:
• Lab (position: 0.5, 2.5) – Processes science packs.
• Offshore Pump (Working) (position: -7.5, 25.5) – Draws water; currently free of warnings but subject to repeated pipeline connection reattempts.
• Offshore Pump (position: -4.5, 26.5) – Repositioned water supply unit; warning: [“no fluid present in connections”].
• Boiler (Original) (position: 2.0, 17.5) – Standard boiler providing basic functionality.
• Boiler (Repositioned) (position: 10.0, 6.5) – Fueled with coal; status: NOT_CONNECTED, warnings: [“no input liquid”, “no fluid present in connections”].
• Steam Engine (position: 5.5, 5.5) – Generates electricity; status: NOT_CONNECTED, warnings: [“not connected to power network”, “no input liquid”, “no fluid present in connections”].
• Electricity Network – Composed of small electric poles at designated positions.
Note: Multiple multi-node pipeline connection attempts have been made to convey water from the Offshore Pump at (-7.5, 25.5) to the Boiler at (10.0, 6.5). All reattempts (using L-shaped, extended, revised, and manual linear routes) have failed due to connection misalignments and buildability issues.

### Pipe Production Facility at position (3.5, 0.5)
Consists of:
• Assembling Machine (position: 3.5, 0.5) – Configured for pipe crafting.
• Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5) – Stores crafted pipes.
• Electricity Network – Comprised of small electric poles linking production components.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Pipeline Connection Errors
 - Verify that both source and target connection points for multi-segment pipelines are unobstructed, correctly aligned, and within the required range.
 - Ensure that the fluid output from the source exactly matches the input expected by the target to avoid mismatches (e.g. errors indicating “fluids currently at source … not needed”).
 - When using intermediate nodes, double-check node placements to confirm all segments meet at buildable tiles.

• Pipeline Placement Errors
 - Manual placement failures citing “position not buildable” indicate that the target coordinates are unsuitable. Confirm tile buildability prior to attempting pipe placement along a calculated linear path.

• Offshore Pump Repositioning and API Usage
 - Undefined function errors (e.g. “shift_entity is not defined”) reveal use of non-existent API functions. Use only functions that are properly defined (such as get_entity or rotate_entity) to adjust entity positions.
 - Validate entity retrieval before and after repositioning; errors from get_entity indicate that the expected entity is not present at the target coordinates.

• Crafting and Resource Dependency Issues
 - Crafting failures for additional pipes due to missing sub-ingredients (such as iron-plate) suggest that the smelting and crafting chain is not adequately supplying required materials. Ensure that production of essential items is in place before initiating dependent craft actions.

NAMESPACE
────────────────────────
• get_entity(entity: Any, position: Any) -> Any  
 Retrieves an entity of the specified type at the given position. On success, returns the entity; on failure, raises an exception if no entity is found.

• pipe_entity(pipe: entities.Pipe) -> Any  
 Processes a pipe entity during connection routines, facilitating assembly of pipeline segments.

• rotate_entity(entity: Any, direction: Any) -> Any  
 Rotates the given entity to the specified direction to correct alignment during placement.

Important Variables:
• pump_working (OffshorePump) – Holds the working offshore pump entity at position (-7.5, 25.5).
• new_pump_pos (Position) – Stores the target position for attempted offshore pump repositioning.
• pipe_count (int) – Represents the current number of pipes available in the inventory.
• distance (float) – Computed distance between designated start and end positions during manual pipeline construction.
• final_inventory (Inventory) – Snapshot of current inventory item counts after recent crafting and placement attempts.
